comment: Enjoyed this class.  Would recommend this teacher.  She is really knowledgeable & caring.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Mad respect for Prof. Moser.  Helped me out inside & outside of class.  Is an awesome teacher! read the chapters before you go to class & turn everything in on time.  Need to study for exams cause they can be hard.  Use the power points & study guides.
Awesome class!
Awesome Professor.  Recommend this class.  Be prepared to read & go to class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Learned loads in this class.  Very different from high school health.  I lost 25lbs during the semester.  This is real-life stuff that you will take lessons away from. Show up to class prepared & do the work. Participate in discussions & ask if you have questions.  Professor Moser was really cool!
Really caring teacher.  She is passionate, open & always willing to help.  Loved this class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Cool class.  Will make you work for the grade, but material is really interesting.  Do the assignments & turn work in on time to get a good grade.  Power points give you everything you need, but you also have to read the book.  Ms. Moser makes learning easy on the eyes!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Moser was fantastic! She answered all my questions & spent time outside of class to help me with the material.  She really cares about her students.  Labs were fun.  Tests are hard but you will pass if you do the work & use the study guide.  I would recommend this class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Awesome class! Changed my major to Exercise Science after taking it. She is a tough grader, but this is college guys, so if you study & turn up to class you'll be fine. Read the book, do the work & don't act entitled & you will love this class!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Enjoyed the class. Was tough but learned a bunch. People had issues cause they thought a health class would be cake & didn't take it serious.  Gives you every opportunity to be successful (extra credit, clear rubrics) but won't spoon-feed you. informative lectures. PowerPoints posted. Impressed how she delt with a medical emergency in class.

Test questions were taken from all course material.  If you're prepared you'll be fine.  PowerPoints & study guides are posted.  Every assessment (labs, assignments etc.) have a rubric, so there is no guessing about expectations.  Prof. Moser was always available if I needed help & is incredibly passionate about her subject.  Loved the class!

Made an easy class the hardest thing in the world. She is super serious about health and her class. Does not give you any chances to improve your grade. Lectures with powerpoints so quickly, it's nearly impossible to take notes. Her tests are extremly difficult. I would NOT recommend this teacher. Don't make my mistake.

I took her last semester and it was tough. 4 test, all failed but still managed to get a B in the class. Do all the labs and other assignments and you should be fine. she does offer extra credit by doing 2 5k runs (helped me out a ton). she grades very harshly on labs and independent activities but you can still end up with a B.

If u don't know the answer to her question from the chapter she will put u on her "naughty" list and will get points deducted for not coming to class prepared. Her answer to every question is "u would know the answer if u read the textbook" Avoid this class. Makes Health class way harder than it needs to be. Labs are easy but she'll give you a B..

She is really really tough. I don't even understand WHY. She has a tendency to be extremely rude to students for simply asking questions on how she wants particular assignments done. Tests are pretty impossible because of how specific they are - and she won't even give you the power-points (which she flies through) to study off of! Best to avoid.

Horrible. Dropped her class in Fall 2014, and this was her first or second time teaching. Goes throw power points so quickly, doesn't post notes on d2l, and grades the labs rather harshly. Tests are pretty bad, I got a 70 on the first two before dropping. Good news? There is no final.

She does not let students get the powerpoint unless you attend class which is fine except in class she flies through them and won't slow down. She was rude to most students. And I overall did not respect her because i felt like she did not respect me.

All the reviews I read was true. As a gen ed class that everyone has to take regarding their major, it shouldn't be this difficult. 4 tests, no final (thank god). failed the first 3 tests and probably will fail the last one. The labs are mostly in class, fairly easy but have to write a perfect reflection paragraph in order to get full points.

Her tests are a joke. Taking notes won't help because she's so specific about everything. She says if you don't read the book you won't pass, even if you read it from the first to the last page you still won't pass.

Don't take Im already gonna fail this class. She's just a ridiculous teacher half test questions are from book so what's the point of taking the notes when most of the questions are from the book I've already failed this class
Avoid her at all costs. A gen ed class shouldn't be this hard. she flies through her power points (doesn't post them on d2l) and is very rude when you ask her to go back.

Ms. Moser doesn't not let you take pictures of her slides and also she doesn't post her slides on D2L. She doesn't give out study guides to help you for the test and she goes very fast through the PowerPoint notes.
haven't passed one test. I take all notes she gives half the questions on tests are from the book. Avoid her at all costs

If you read the book before you come to class, like she says to do, you'll do OK. The test questions are from her lecture, labs, book, & anything else she uses, like videos. She uses PowerPoint, but doesn't post them online and won't give them out; have to show up to get it or rely on someone's notes. She doesn't take attendance, but suggest going.

We had to do an independent lab and had to go to the wellness center for an instructional class. We had to get the schedule signed by the teacher and she did. I turned in the assignment and got an 80 on it just because I didn't circle the class on the schedule even though the instructor signed all the way around it and I talked about it in my paper

You have to know EVERYTHING done in class. She shows us PowerPoint slides from the textbook, then adds a few of her own words in, which she barely gives you enough time to write down. She expects us to learn the specifics, even though she is not specific when giving instructions for labs and activities. You will dread going to this class.
Has high expectations. Is passionate about the material. Great Professor
Treats you like an adult. Act like one
she doesn't care and will blame you for bad equipment treats it like a 400 level class
